boat.name: Brandaen
boat.full_description:
'Brandaen' is a steel replica built in Brightlingsea to the lines of racing smack Ellen and a 'skellinger'. Designed by R Watts, the hull was built at the Arma Marine Shipyard. Her Dutch owners started to fit her out in 1987, basing the interior on a Victorian style with panelled doors.

From her base in the Netherlands, Brandaen has cruised extensively since 1992 including the Frisian Islands, Zeeland, east and south coasts of England, Brittany, Belgium, Spain and the Azores, the Baltic and Douarnenez. In 2013 she took part in the OGA 50th anniversary celebrations on the East Coast and at Cowes.
boat.short_description: According to her skipper 'Brandaen is a real eye-catcher. She is very fast, stable and in spite of her size, easy to handle for two persons.' Built of steel in Brightlingsea, 1980, she's currently based in the Netherlands.
